column2: zelliebean, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My cholesterol and triglycerides actually increased after being on medication for about 6 months so I won't be buying any more of it and probably won't finish what I still have.  I have also altered my diet and eat much healthier food than several years ago - have dropped 2 - 3 sizes in clothes and probably 50 pounds over last 2 - 3 years.  My cholesterol has always ranged from 220 - 240 since I was in 20's and am now 56.  Not sure what else I can do and I have not plans to take statin drugs.  This doctor is not insisting on drugs - he just says to watch diet.  My "good" cholesterol is in normal range as is the ratio, but the total cholesterol and "bad" cholesterol are considered to be borderline.

column2: FarHorizon, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I quit Lipotor because of side effects including joint and muscle pain (severe).  I switched to non-prescription Cholest-Off and although it was effective for cholesterol, I have the same side effects.  I'm now discontinuing the use of this because of the severe side effects.

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this for about one month. I quit taking statins due to severe leg cramps, plus I have been diagnosed with peripreral neuropathy which is also tied to statins. No leg cramps for the firs couple of weeks but now I am getting them almost as bad as when I was on statins. I have not had my cholesterol tested since using this so I cannot comment on that. Not sure what I am going to do at this point but I probably will not continue taking it.

column2: fran, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: lowereed total cholesterol in about 2 months I am also taking zetia 10 mg

column2: Loves cheese, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I can't fully respond to the stars until I get my labwork done again. But I was on a prescription generic statin which did work - brought my overall cholesterol down from 290 to 199. It's side effects were loose stools and brittle fingernails. I have taken almost a whole bottle of Cholest off, often taking right as I eat or after because I forget to take it 15-30 minutes before, and recently have begun to have the same side-effects as the statin: Loose stools, sometimes with urgency, and brittle fingernails. I wonder if wine exacerbates this as the morning after I have 1-2 glasses I have a worse problem all the next morning. I mildly exercise, I am not over weight, I have never smoked and do not have heart disease in my family history so thinking of stopping all of these type of meds/supplements, but I would likely have to greatly reduce eating meat and dairy to keep my cholesterol lower. Red rice yeast did not lower my cholesterol but I had no side effects. Hoping the medical community finds that genetically high cholesterol without the other risk factors is ok.

column2: COhio, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: My total cholesterol was a little high and the ratio of HDL to LDL wasn't good either.  I had 6 months to improve my habits and avoid medication.  I started taking CholestOff, cut back on the junky foods and exercised a little more often. I didn't make any major lifestyle changes, just cut back on the foods I really knew I shouldn't be eating anyway. Six months later, my blood test results made me and my Dr. very happy. They were the best numbers I've had in years. No need for prescription meds. Everything should be fine as long as I refrain from my former bad food habits.

column2: Tex, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: It really works, although doctors are skeptical of it's actual results. But, since I have taken this product my total cholestrol has been in satisfactory ranges.

column2: TimSez, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My total cholesterol level has averaged 222 over the past 6 years.  I used Cholestoff  as described, twice a day from 15 to 30 minutes before meals.  Maybe 4 times per week I would forget to take the pills before going out to eat.  I used it for 3 full months before another blood test.  I did not make any other changes to my diet or exercise, because I really wanted to know what this would do all by itself, and my next approach would have been red yeast rice.  My wife made the comment that having to schedule my meals probably reduced my food intake, and that may have been true sometimes, but I noticed that I actually found myself eating cheese and red meat more frequently thinking the Cholestoff maybe would prevent the cholesterol absorption.  I'm serious, although I've never had a terrible diet, I wanted to see if this product could help give me some relief in terms of eating things I really enjoy (in moderation).  I was ready for some bad numbers because of that.  I was very pleasantly surprised when my doctor called me this morning and said, "whatever you are doing, keep it up".  My numbers were:Dec 2010 before Cholestoff: HDL = 70, LDL = 148, Total Chol = 232, Triglycerides = 72, Ratio = 3.3Mar 2011 after Cholestoff: HDL = 64 (2nd best ever), LDL = 125 (best ever), Total Chol = 198 (best ever), Triglycerides = 47 (best ever), Ratio = 3.1 (best ever)I think that's awesome. I still want to know more about the safety of the product, and I am going to my Urologist to see what he says about the Calcium additives since I suffer from Calcium Oxalate kidney stones, but I plan to continue taking it and see what next year's numbers bring.  I also want to increase my exercise for the next round as I should.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My wifes cadiolgist suggested she take this, so I took it also, have taken 3-4 weeks.  Last year cholestrol 222, yesterday had my yearly physical, choles TOTAL 182.  LDL down, HDL UP. Not sure why, did not exercise and gained 5 lbs. I am not saying this stuff did that, but have no other explantion.
